H0.text: Radioactivity is the spontaneous emission of particles and radiation from atomic nuclei.

H1.text: Intensity is the term used to describe the spontaneous emission of particles and radiation from atomic nuclei.

H2.text: Vibration is the term used to describe the spontaneous emission of particles and radiation from atomic nuclei.

H3.text: Microscopic is the term used to describe the spontaneous emission of particles and radiation from atomic nuclei.

A4.text: Radioactive decay is the process by which an unstable atomic nucleus loses energy by radiation.

A5.text: In alpha decay, a particle containing two protons and two neutrons, equivalent to a He nucleus, breaks out of the parent nucleus.
